author: @type
title: Sterling Heights woman to stand trial in torture of boyfriend's mother
text:
A Sterling Heights woman accused of torturing and abusing her boyfriend's 80-year-old mother will face a trial in Macomb County Circuit Court. Laura Tisdelle , 40, was charged with torture, first-degree vulnerable adult abuse, unlawful imprisonment and third-offense domestic violence. If convicted, she faces up to more than 40 years behind bars, the Macomb County Prosecutor's Office said Thursday.
Tisdelle allegedly was the sole caregiver of her boyfriend's mother while her boyfriend went on a five-day trip in June. Upon his return home, Tisdelle's boyfriend found his mother with her hands tied together, restrained to the bed, severely beaten and laying in her own urine and feces, prosecutors said.
"We are committed to pursuing justice for the alleged torture and abuse inflicted upon this elderly woman," Macomb County Prosecutor Peter Lucido said in a statement. "This commitment drives us to passionately advocate for the dignity and well-being of individuals who are unable to protect themselves."
Tisdelle was initially arraigned June 23 in the 41A District Court in Sterling Heights.
Her next court date is scheduled for 1:30 p.m. on Jan. 8.
JAimery@detroitnews.com

author: The Canadian Press
title: 2-year-old son of B.C.â€™s David Foster wows with drumming talents in viral video - Kelowna Capital News
text: The two-year-old son of famed Canadian producer David Foster and singer Katharine McPhee is lighting up the internet with his musical talents. In a video posted to TikTok by McPhee and Instagram by Foster, the pairâ€™s son is seen playing an impressive drum solo alongside a recording of Michael Jacksonâ€™s song â€œRock with You.â€ Foster is seen in the video seated watching his son, bopping his head along to the beat while the two-year-old rocks out on a mini drum set complete with his name, Rennie Foster, splashed across the bass drum. McPheeâ€™s video included the caption â€œmy 2 year old baby is a genius.â€ Foster, the 74-year-old musician and composer, is a 16-time Grammy winner who was born in Victoria. He married McPhee, a 39-year-old singer and actress who was the runner-up in the 2006 season of American Idol, in 2019. Celebrities like Kristin Chenoweth, Questlove, Nicole Sherzinger, Joey McIntyre, Sharon Stone, Debra Messing, Charlie Puth and others took to the video comments to hype up the young drummer. READ ALSO: [Celine Song, Ryan Gosling, Martin Short among Canadians up for Golden Globes](https://www.todayinbc.com/entertainment/celine-song-ryan-gosling-martin-short-among-canadians-up-for-golden-globes-7293585) The Canadian Press

author: Caitlin Agnew
title: Newly endowed awards will recognize the academic achievements of U of T Law students
text:
Supplied photo by Calvin Thomas courtesy of Osler, Hoskin & Harcourt LLP . A first-of-its-kind gift made by Terry Burgoyne ( LLB 1981 ), a graduate of the University of Toronto Faculty of Law, will endow new academic awards recognizing student achievement in U of Tâ€™s juris doctor (JD) program.
The Burgoyne Award of Excellence will be the facultyâ€™s largest recognition program, awarded to JD students across all three years, as nominated by their professors for scholarly excellence. Up to twenty inaugural awardees, each receiving a $1,000 prize, will be named later this academic year.
â€œSupporting our extraordinary students is always one of the facultyâ€™s top priorities. This includes our robust financial aid program, fellowship opportunities and academic prizes,â€ says University Professor and Dean Jutta BrunnÃ©e, James Marshall Tory Deanâ€™s Chair. â€œIt is wonderful that Terry has chosen to endow these new academic awards, which will honour our most exceptional law students every year.â€
A mentor to U of T students for many years, Burgoyne, a partner and general counsel emeritus with Osler, Hoskin & Harcourt LLP, says his gift is a meaningful way to stay engaged with the law school and student awardees while bolstering the facultyâ€™s academic prizes.
â€œThereâ€™s a lot of depth to the law students at U of T because of its high admission standards,â€ says Burgoyne, himself a Deanâ€™s list student over all three years. â€œProfessors have been looking for ways to help build rÃ©sumÃ©s for their students and distinguish a student who did the best in a particular class.â€
â€œThe hope is that these awards will acquire a certain stature over time and be recognized.â€
From rural Nova Scotia to Toronto Burgoyne, who grew up in rural Nova Scotia and attended Dalhousie University for his undergraduate studies, says he never met a lawyer prior to attending U of T. He says his decision to come to the â€œbig unknown cityâ€ of Toronto was daunting yet serendipitous â€“ a choice that changed the trajectory of his life and career.
â€œMy best friend at Dalhousie was applying to law school. We took the LSAT together and applied to the same schools. In those days, [schools] could not send off acceptances before February 1. On February 3, I got my U of T acceptance, but I had not heard from Dalhousie Law School, so I said, â€˜Okay, that made my decision easy.â€™â€
By the time his Dalhousie acceptance letter arrived â€“ postmarked February 1 â€“ it was early March. At the time, Burgoyne lived only two blocks away from Dalhousieâ€™s law school.
Gratitude is one of the reasons Iâ€™ve wanted to give back. Law school had such a profound positive impact on my own life. â€œI often joke that Iâ€™m the Canada Post scholar at U of T Law,â€ he says. â€œHad it arrived, it would have been the easier choice to stay [in Nova Scotia]. But I would not have ended up at Osler; Toronto firms did not recruit outside of Ontario in those days,â€ he says. â€œI feel lucky in many ways that I picked the right law school for me, the right career and the right firm. These decisions were made with very little information at the time.â€
Gratitude is one of the reasons Iâ€™ve wanted to give back. Law school had such a profound positive impact on my own life. Burgoyne, who spent his 43-year career at Osler, including six years as managing partner, says he started out as a typical business lawyer, in areas including banking, insolvency, mergers and acquisition and public finance. But as the world became more complicated, Burgoyne says practice became more specialized.
â€œTowards the end of my career, I specialized in private or negotiated mergers and acquisitions, as opposed to takeover bids and public mergers and acquisitions,â€ says Burgoyne. â€œLaw is a tough career sometimes. Itâ€™s a lot of work, but itâ€™s a very rewarding career. Iâ€™m glad I stuck with it.â€
Words of encouragement He hopes the Burgoyne Award of Excellence will provide awardees with extra validation and encouragement as they pursue their studies.
â€œKeep at it. You can find your niche because not everyone is going to be good at everything. If you find the class that you love and you put a lot of effort into it, thereâ€™s a reward for that,â€ he says.
â€œGratitude is one of the reasons Iâ€™ve wanted to give back. Law school had such a profound positive impact on my own life.â€
Explore related campaign priorities: Contribute your time and talent Support student success

author: CNN Newsource
title: 10-year-old nonverbal autistic girl attacked on school van, mom says
text:
10-year-old nonverbal autistic girl attacked on school van, mom says
By Ricky Sayer
Click here for updates on this story
PITTSBURGH, Pennsylvania (
KDKA) â€” A private school transportation service will no longer transport students to and from Pittsburgh Conroy Education Center after a mother went public with how her autistic and nonverbal 10-year-old daughter was left with bite marks and bruises all over her body.
The girlâ€™s mother, Shareena Johnson, told KDKA-TV that Pittsburgh Public Schools officials told her another student attacked her daughter while she was riding a van to Conroy Education Center on Monday. Johnson was called to the school and told her she should bring her daughter to the hospital.
â€œThey said she had been bit and scratched,â€ Johnson said. â€œWhen I got there, I was in complete shock. I could not have imagined the severity of the injuries on her body. I had never seen bite marks so deep. The bruising and the swelling were awful. I was told that she was shaking and still actively being attacked when the van pulled into the school. The driver did not pull over. He did not call anyone.â€
Pittsburgh Public Schools contracts Krise Transportation to pick up and drop off students at Conroy.
â€œAll the other children were also nonverbal on the van. There is no evidence as to what happened, how it happened, how long it occurred,â€ Johnson said.
She said the company told her it had a video of what happened on the bus. But when she called the district the next day to see the video, she was told there was no recording because it was a new van.
Johnson wants the company to do something.
â€œI want the driver to take accountability. I want them to change their protocol to one that actually keeps children safe,â€ Johnson said.
As for her daughter, because she is nonverbal, answering a simple question isnâ€™t easy.
â€œWe donâ€™t know how sheâ€™s doing. And that is why itâ€™s so hard for me because I know itâ€™s hard for her,â€ Johnson said.
When KDKA-TV asked Pittsburgh Public Schools for comment, it said Krise Transportation would no longer transport students to and from Conroy.
KDKA-TV followed up by asking if Krise provides transportation for students at any other Pittsburgh schools and if changes would be made. The district responded by reiterating how Krise Transportation would no longer transport students to Conroy.
â€œAs this incident involves students, no further information is available,â€ a PPS spokesperson said.
Johnson called the change surprising, saying Krise transported students on Wednesday afternoon. But she said it is good news, adding Krise Transportation should not transport students to any Pittsburgh school.
KDKA-TV called called Krise Transportation on Wednesday. A representative hung up before we could directly ask for comment.
Please note: This content carries a strict local market embargo. If you share the same market as the contributor of this article, you may not use it on any platform.

author: Shukriya Shahi
title: US Issues 'Do Not Travel' Warning for 21 Countries Ahead of Summer
text:
As summer vacation begins, the US State Department has raised red flags for travelers. A total of 21 countries have been slapped with the most severe Level 4 advisory â€” â€˜Do Not Travelâ€™ â€” citing reasons like war, terrorism, crime, and unstable governments.
The travel advisory system has four levels:
Level 1: Exercise Normal Precautions
Ideal for safe travel. Countries include:
ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ Japan, ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡² Bermuda, ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡¾ Cayman Islands
No major threats reported, but travelers should remain alert.
Level 2: Exercise Increased Caution
Travel is still allowed but requires awareness of risks such as crime or unrest.
Key countries include:
ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡³ China, ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¦ Saudi Arabia, ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡¸ Spain
Level 3: Reconsider Travel
Serious threats like terrorism or political instability.
Countries listed:
ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡¬ Egypt, ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡´ Colombia, ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡ª Niger, ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡² Jamaica, ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡© Chad
Level 4: Do Not Travel
The US government strongly advises avoiding these 21 countries due to conflict zones, crime against foreigners, or extremist threats.
Complete List of â€˜Do Not Travelâ€™ Countries (Level 4):
ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡« Afghanistan
ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡¾ Belarus
ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡« Burkina Faso
ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡² Burma (Myanmar)
ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡« Central African Republic
ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡© Democratic Republic of the Congo
ğŸ‡­ğŸ‡¹ Haiti
ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡· Iran
ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¶ Iraq
ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡§ Lebanon
ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡¾ Libya
ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡± Mali
ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡µ North Korea
ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡º Russia
ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡´ Somalia
ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¸ South Sudan
ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡© Sudan
ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¾ Syria
ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Ukraine
ğŸ‡»ğŸ‡ª Venezuela
ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡ª Yemen
High-Risk Mexican States & Gaza
The advisory also extends to six Mexican states:
Colima, Guerrero, Michoacan, Sinaloa, Tamaulipas, and Zacatecas â€“ flagged due to organized crime and kidnapping.
Gaza is also under a Level 4 alert due to ongoing conflict.
Travel Smart: Tips for Americans Abroad
The State Department urges all travelers to:
- Enroll in the Smart Traveler Enrollment Program (STEP)
- Follow @TravelGov on social media
- Review country-specific security reports
- Have an emergency contingency plan
- Check off the Travelerâ€™s Checklist before departure
Bottom Line: If youâ€™re planning a summer getaway, double-check your destinationâ€™s advisory level. Safety comes firstâ€”some dream vacations might be better saved for another time.

author: Simon Carmichael, Le Soleil
title: La Ville Â«trÃ¨s satisfaiteÂ» du dÃ©neigement
text: Â«On a rÃ©ussi Ã  faire ce quâ€™on voulait faire. Il nâ€™y a pas eu dâ€™enjeuxÂ», insiste le directeur du dÃ©neigement de la Ville de QuÃ©bec, FranÃ§ois Moisan. Â«Le seul enjeu quâ€™on a eu, câ€™est la trÃ¨s grosse quantitÃ© de neige qui est tombÃ©e.Â» Dans les deux derniers jours, le fonctionnaire a accordÃ© des dizaines dâ€™entrevues pour rÃ©pÃ©ter la mÃªme chose : la Ville est Â«trÃ¨s satisfaiteÂ» de son enlÃ¨vement de la neige. Mais sur les rÃ©seaux sociaux comme dans les mÃ©dias, les critiques fusent par rapport aux opÃ©rations de derniers jours. Plusieurs citoyens des quartiers centraux sâ€™Ã©tonnent de voir leur rue encore enneigÃ©e mÃªme aprÃ¨s deux jours de Â«feux clignotantsÂ», oÃ¹ leur routine a Ã©tÃ© perturbÃ©e par une opÃ©ration dÃ©neigement. Des commerÃ§ants de la haute-ville se sont plaints de lâ€™indisponibilitÃ© des stationnements et le manque dâ€™accÃ¨s aux trottoirs a Ã©tÃ© dÃ©noncÃ©. Vendredi, Ã  la veille dâ€™une autre tempÃªte majeure, la Ville de QuÃ©bec a annoncÃ© une troisiÃ¨me nuit dâ€™opÃ©ration dÃ©neigement consÃ©cutive dans plusieurs quartiers. Deux nuits, Â«câ€™est normalÂ» Le porte-parole de la Ville de QuÃ©bec comprend lâ€™impatience de ceux qui habitent dans un secteur oÃ¹ le travail nâ€™est pas complÃ©tÃ©. Mais il insiste: il est Â«normalÂ» quâ€™une opÃ©ration de si grande envergure sâ€™Ã©tale sur deux nuits. Et ce nâ€™est rien de nouveau, martÃ¨le FranÃ§ois Moisan, qui gravite dans lâ€™administration municipale depuis plus de vingt ans. Â«Il nâ€™y a rien dâ€™anormal Ã  prendre deux nuits pour une tempÃªte dâ€™une telle ampleur.Â»â€” FranÃ§ois Moisan, directeur des relations publiques Ã  la Ville de QuÃ©bec M. Moisan souligne dâ€™ailleurs que les tempÃªtes avec plus de 30 centimÃ¨tres de neige, comme celle du dÃ©but de la semaine, sont Â«raresÂ». Â«On a des hivers oÃ¹ on nâ€™a pas dâ€™Ã©pisode comme celui-lÃ Â», rapporte-t-il. Â«Câ€™Ã©tait une grosse tempÃªte, Ã§a prend de grosses opÃ©rations. Aux dires du maire Bruno Marchand, les Ã©quipes analysent Â«en continuÂ» leurs processus. Mais demeure quâ€™Â«une tempÃªte, câ€™est un chaosÂ», souligne-t-il. Â«Il tombe 3 cm Ã  Paris et ils sont bloquÃ©s pendant trois jours. Ici, il tombe 35 cm. Les gens de QuÃ©bec sont exigeants â€” et ils ont raison de lâ€™Ãªtre â€” [mais] il faut gÃ©rer le chaos le moins longtemps possible et câ€™est pour Ã§a quâ€™on travaille Ã  toujours sâ€™amÃ©liorerÂ», a-t-il dÃ©clarÃ© en entrevue avec Le Soleil jeudi. Des opÃ©rations Â«ciblÃ©esÂ», bientÃ´t Â«amÃ©liorÃ©esÂ» La Ville de QuÃ©bec fait tout en son pouvoir pour Ã©viter Ã  ses rÃ©sidents de dÃ©placer leurs voitures pour rien, assure le fonctionnaire. Mais lors des opÃ©rations dÃ©neigement, lâ€™administration municipale prÃ©fÃ¨re voir grand et libÃ©rer plus de rues que pas assez. Â«On espÃ¨re toujours pouvoir tout faire en une nuit, rÃ©sume FranÃ§ois Moisan. Et on planifie en consÃ©quence. Mais parfois, selon la quantitÃ© de neige, la lourdeur de celle-ci, les pÃ©pins mÃ©caniques ou les remorquages, on nâ€™y arrive pasÂ». Le dÃ©gagement des voies de circulation est alors priorisÃ©. Â«On cible le plus possible avec les feux clignotants, mais parfois les opÃ©rations prÃ©vues sont modifiÃ©es en cours de route.Â»â€” FranÃ§ois Moisan, directeur des relations publiques Ã  la Ville de QuÃ©bec Le Â«ciblageÂ» des rues appelÃ©es Ã  se mettre en mode dÃ©neigement pourrait Ãªtre amÃ©liorÃ© dans les prochaines annÃ©es, indique le fonctionnaire. Lâ€™ajout de nombreux feux clignotants dâ€™un bout Ã  lâ€™autre de la ville et [les investissements en tÃ©lÃ©mÃ©trie](https://www.lesoleil.com/actualites/actualites-locales/la-capitale/2023/11/17/deneigement-suivre-les-grattes-en-temps-reel-bientot-possible-a-quebec-N766FZ6WWVECLEG4JZ3BFQCUGE/) rendront le suivi des Ã©quipes de la ville plus facile. Et pour la tempÃªte prÃ©vue samedi, FranÃ§ois Moisan lâ€™assure : Â«les formidables les Ã©quipes de la Ville de QuÃ©bec sont prÃªtesÂ». Avec Ã‰milie Pelletier, Le Soleil

author: Randy Slovacek
title: TV Ad Captures Romance In French Countryside
text:
This is one of the most romantic television commercials weâ€™ve seen, and it just happens to be gay.
The personal lubricant brand,
Boy Butter, has released the third installment of a love story trilogy between two men, Facundo Rodriguez and Jerreth Ludwig. The video â€“ titled â€œChateau Dâ€™Amourâ€ â€“ opens with a sweeping shot of a French country setting. We discover Ludwig in an ivy-covered house and Rodriguez racing through the forest. The men soon find themselves face-to-face and reach for each other for a romantic kiss.
Boy Butter founder Eyal Feldman calls the spot â€œour grandest commercial to date.â€ Donna Feldman, Eyalâ€™s sister and co-founder of Straw Hat Productions, who produced the ad, explains the arc of the love story trilogy: â€œOur
first commercial was about empowerment, the second was glamour, and the third one is pure romanceâ€”a short film only thirty seconds long, seldom seen in television advertising today.â€
The sensual new ad spot will debut on national TV on Friday, January 5, during Season 16 of RuPaulâ€™s Drag Race on MTV. The commercial will air in New York, New Jersey, Chicago, Los Angeles, San Diego, and nationwide in Canada on OutTV. Boy Butter has been running ad spots in support of RPDR since 2012. In 2021, Straw Hat and Feldman launched this
 new campaign reminiscent of iconic 1990s fragrance and fashion campaigns.
Following tonightâ€™s premiere, Boy Butter plans to expand the campaign to broader market outlets, including CNBC and Fox Business, and make a splash on sports networks, such as ESPN, Fox Sports, and NFL Network.
Founded in 2003,
http://boybutter.com/ manufactures personal lubricants that are long lasting, organic, hypo-allergenic, and washable.
